intro: Solidago virgaurea var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth goldenrod, is a variant of the goldenrod genus native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as meadows, marshes, and streambanks. The plant features upright, branching stems covered with fine, yellowish-green leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators and is often used in wetland restoration projects.
